Mitflit.name: Митфлит
Mitflit.description:
Митфлиты — жалкие трусы, которых легко запугать и заставить служить другим существам или даже чуть более могущественным лидерам митфлитов. Они приручают насекомых, пауков и других мелких вредителей, чтобы те служили им верными союзниками. Митфлиты утратили большую часть своей наследственной магии, в результате чего эти существа полны сомнений и неуверенности. Митфлиты находят товарищей в других низших существах этого мира и создают крепкие узы дружбы с паразитами — похоже единственными существами, готовыми их принять. Социальная структура, даже та, в которой над ними издеваются, частично заполняет пустоту в личности большинства митфлитов, и они редко бунтуют или выходят из себя, если только их ярость не достигает предела.

Гремлины — это жестокие феи трикстеры и диверсанты, которые полностью приспособились к жизни во Вселенной, нашедшие определенные ниши для своей изобретательной разрушительной деятельности. Почти все гремлины любят разрушать или ломать вещи, будь то что-то физическое, как устройство или транспортное средство, так и что-то неосязаемое, как союз или отношения. Самая большая радость для гремлина — наблюдать за тем, как рушатся комплексные творения, желательно после незначительного, тщательно спланированного толчка от гремлина. Гремлины склонны принижать, задирать и даже убивать своих меньших сородичей, особенно митфлитов, которых гремлины посильнее уничижительно называют "мешочками (baggies)".

items.name: Разговор с животными (только членистоногие, по желанию)
Отвращение к себе
items.description: Из-за ненависти митфлита к себе, он легко поддается влиянию. Он получает штраф −4 к КС Воли против проверок @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q], and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6].

items.name: Мстительная злость
items.description: Пока он не @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Напуган}, митфлит получает бонус состояния +2 к броскам урона по существам, которые до этого наносили ему урон или мучили его.

Morrigna.name: Morrigna
Morrigna.description:
Bounty hunters and investigators, morrignas seek out creatures who thwart death or interfere with the natural flow of souls. Morrignas dress in flowing spider silk and wear masks reminiscent of webs, as they consider patient and watchful spiders to be their spiritual kin.

Psychopomps are guardians and shepherds of the dead in the Boneyard, the vast plane of graves where mortal souls are judged and sent on to their eternal rewards or damnations. Psychopomps ensure that the dead come to terms with their transition from mortality and are properly sorted into the appropriate afterlife. They also protect souls from being preyed upon by supernatural predators. Nearly all psychopomps wear masks, especially when they're likely to be interacting with mortals, although the types of masks they wear are as varied as the psychopomps themselves. The courts of the Boneyard preside in Requian, a somber yet melodic language spoken slowly with various tonal shifts.

Many psychopomps are intimately involved with the Boneyard's massive bureaucracy. Few pursue mercy, justice, or personal gain; their duties to Pharasma and her Boneyard are supreme. Nevertheless, individual psychopomps interpret their duties in different ways, which might put them in conflict with mortals or even with each other.
Morrigna.allSaves: бонус состояния +1 ко всем спасброскам от магии

items.name: Бонус состояния +1 ко всем спасброскам от магии
Изменение формы
items.description:
A morrigna can take the appearance of any Small or Medium animal or humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal. Unless they choose to manifest their web wrappings in their new form, they cannot make web wrappings Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

items.name: Касание пастыря
items.description: A morrigna's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R] property rune and deal @Damage[4d6[void]]{4d6 урона пустотой} damage to living creatures or @Damage[4d6[vitality]]{4d6 урона жизненностью} damage to undead.

items.name: Spider Minions
items.description: The morrigna summons a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.4ISm82EYQeOndynw] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.NcYbJS5PWBGdNDqh]. These spiders have the summoned trait and remain for 10 minutes or until reduced to 0 Hit Points, whichever comes first. The morrigna does not need to Sustain the Spell to direct these summoned creatures, and the morrigna can have any number of summoned spiders in existence at once. The morrigna can see through the eyes of any of their summoned spiders at any time.

items.name: Wrappings Lash
items.description:
Триггер: A creature within reach of the morrigna's web wrappings uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check

Эффект: The morrigna makes a web wrappings Strike against the triggering creature. If the strike is a critical hit, the triggering action is disrupted.

Mountain Oni.name: Mountain Oni
Mountain Oni.description:
Mountain oni are the most common oni and often considered the least sophisticated. While other oni might have a stronger connection to the spiritual world, mountain oni have little interest in anything beyond satisfying their relentless appetites. Sloth and gluttony are common vices among mountain oni, which can allow them to coexist with nearby villages so long as they're well fed, but more ambitious mountain oni can often be found leading ogre war parties or orchestrating violent bandit raids. It's rare for mountain oni to live solitary existences, but those who do prefer to maraud the countryside or exploit villages and hoard the spoils for themselves.

Oni are large, brutal creatures originating in Tian Xia who resemble humanoids with brightly colored skin, tusks, and horns. Though commonly mistaken for fiends, the first oni were originally kami, tutelary nature spirits. These kami suffered a terrible trauma, losing their sacred wards to dramatic disasters or the callousness of others, and as a result transformed into the violent creatures they are today. While some believe that oni can be spiritually placated through proper ritual worship that transforms them back into kami, many of these would-be saviors fall to oni's notorious brute strength, flesh-rending teeth, and command of storms.

Oni possess the ability to disguise themselves as other humanoids. They are rarely creative in their disguises, often choosing a specific appearance similar to their oni form and sticking with it. This simplicity catches many by surprise, however, as people assume oni are limited to a single alternate form, which is by no means the case.

items.name: Bean Panic
items.description: Oni are curiously afraid of beans, especially as the seasons begin to change. If a creature Interacts to throw a handful of beans at the oni, the oni becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. While frightened this way, their weakness to spirit damage is increased by 5. The oni then becomes immune to bean panic for 24 hours.

items.name: Изменение формы
items.description:
The mountain oni can take on the appearance of any Medium or Large humanoid creature. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

items.name: Thundering Iron
items.description:
The oni lifts their tetsubo and brings it down in a deafening peal. They make a tetsubo Strike. On a success, the target takes an additional 1d10 sonic damage.

Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around the target, other than the oni, take this damage as well and is pushed 5 feet away from the target.

Mukradi.name: Mukradi
Mukradi.description: Fearsome centipede-like creatures, mukradis are three-headed predators with a devastating array of ways to kill, burn, and dismember. A version of the mukradi that dwells in the Darklands is rumored to exist. It's said these variant mukradis have black scales, and all of their heads spew a black, acidic goo that animates before being reabsorbed by the mukradis.

items.name: Partitioned Anatomy
items.description:
Триггер: The mukradi would be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3], or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]

Эффект: The mukradi confines the debilitating effect to a certain portion of its nervous system, ignoring the effect but causing a maw of its choice to go dormant for the effect's duration. That maw can't be used for a Strike or to Breathe Energy during that time. This ability can't be used if all the mukradi's heads are dormant.

items.name: Spitting Rage
items.description:
Триггер: A creature scores a critical hit on the mukradi

Эффект: The mukradi's Breathe Energy recharges. It can use Breathe Energy immediately as part of this reaction. It can't use this reaction again until it recharges Breathe Energy naturally.

items.name: Breathe Energy
items.description:
The mukradi breathes a blast of energy from one of its three heads; each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true] save.

The mukradi can't Breathe Energy again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Energy]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Кислотная пасть: (кислота), @Template[type:line|distance:60|width:10]{60-футовая линия 10-футовой ширины} кислоты, наносящая @Damage[16d6[acid]]{16d6 урона кислотой}.
  • Огненная пасть: (огонь), @Template[type:cone|distance:60]{60-футовый конус} огня, наносящий @Damage[16d6[fire]]{16d6 урона огнем}.
  • Шоковая пасть: (электричество), @Template[type:line|distance:120]{120-футовая линия} электричества, наносящая @Damage[16d6[electricity]]{16d6 урона электричеством}.

items.name: Разорвать на части
items.description:
The mukradi makes two Strikes with different maws against the same target. If both hit, the target takes an extra @Damage[(2d12+13)[slashing]]{2d12+13 рубящего урона} damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36|basic:true] save. On a critical failure, the creature is torn to pieces and dies.

The mukradi's multiple attack penalty increases only after all the attacks are made.

items.name: Молотить
items.description: The mukradi Strikes once against each creature in its reach. It can make one of these Strikes with each of its maws, one with its tail lash, and the rest with its legs. Each attack takes a –2 circumstance penalty and counts toward the mukradi's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks are made.

items.name: Растоптать
items.description:
Огромный или менее, нога, простой спасбросок @Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true]{Рефлекса}

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

Mummy Guardian.name: Мумия-страж
Mummy Guardian.description:
Большинство мумий-стражей были созданы жестокими и эгоистичными хозяевами, чтобы служить стражами, защищающими их гробницы от посторонних. Традиционный метод создания мумии-стража — это трудоемкий и садистский процесс, который начинается задолго до смерти превращаемой бедной души. Жертву ритуально лишают питательной пищи и вместо этого кормят странными специями, консервантами и токсинами, предназначенными для ускорения иссушения плоти. Жертва остается неподвижной, но болезненно осознающей себя на последних стадиях, когда из нее извлекаются теперь уже бесполезные внутренности. Затем жертву заворачивают в погребальные пелены и помещают в заколдованный некромантией саркофаг, чтобы она ожидала инструкций в потенциально далеком будущем. Разумеется, можно использовать и другие методы для создания мумии-стража из уже умершего тела, те, кто стремится создать эту отвратительную нежить в качестве своих хранителей в загробной жизни, часто считают, что такие методы приводят к созданию неполноценной нежити — боль и агония смерти от мумификации являются необходимым этапом этого процесса.

Независимо от способа своего создания, мумии-стражи — не просто физические оболочки из плоти и костей, они сохраняют частичные, искаженные версии своего разума, в котором осталось достаточно воспоминаний о своей живой личности, лишь чтобы питать гнев нежити и зависть к тем, кто еще жив. Эта жгучая ярость только усиливается веками ожидания в склепе за шанс действовать, поэтому, когда большинство мумий-стражей пробуждаются грабителями гробниц или авантюристами, они не останавливаются ни перед чем в погоне за злобной расправой.

В то время как во многих культурах мумификация практикуется по благим причинам, мумии-нежить создаются с помощью изнурительных ритуалов, обычно, для создания вечно бдительных стражей. Гораздо реже тело, мумифицированное без специальных обрядов, может воскреснуть из-за своей ненависти к живым.
Mummy Guardian.language: плюс любой один язык, известный при жизни

items.name: Алхимическая слабость
items.description: Слабость стража к алхимическим предметам распространяется не только на урон от алхимических предметов, но он также получает 5 урона, когда его обрызгивают не повреждающими алхимическими предметами или накачивают алхимическими ядами, даже если он иммунный к другим их эффектам.

items.name: Blighted Consumption
items.description:
Триггер: A creature within 30 feet eats or drinks (including an alchemical item or potion)

Эффект: The food or drink burns like the caustic substances fed to the mummy before its death. If the creature fails a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] save, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} after they finish the consumption and can't reduce their sickened condition while within 30 feet of any mummy.

items.name: Choking Pain
items.description:
Требования: Последним действием мумии был успешный "Удар" кулаком

Эффект: The mummy shares the pain of its dying moments with the target of that Strike. That creature takes @Damage[3d8[void]]{3d8 урона пустотой} damage with a @Check[type:will|dc:24|basic:true] save. If the creature critically fails the saving throw, it can't speak for 1 round, including to Cast a Spell.

Mummy Pharaoh.name: Мумия фараона
Mummy Pharaoh.description:
While mummy guardians are undead crafted from the corpses of sacrificed—usually unwilling victims—and retain only fragments of their memories, a mummy pharaoh is the result of a deliberate embrace of undeath by a sadistic and cruel ruler. The transformation from life to undeath beneath the scorching desert sand is only somewhat less awful, but as the transition is an intentional bid to escape death by a powerful personality who fully embraces the blasphemous repercussions of the choice, the mummy pharaoh retains its memories and personality intact.

While many cultures practice mummification for benign reasons, undead mummies are created through grueling rituals, typically to provide eternally vigilant guardians. Much more rarely, a body mummified without those special rites can rise again due to its hatred of the living.
Mummy Pharaoh.language: плюс любые два языка, известные при жизни
Mummy Pharaoh.allSaves: +1 состояния ко всем спасброскам от позитивных

items.name: Бонус состояния +1 ко всем спасброскам против жизненности
Реагирующий удар (особый)
items.description:
The mummy pharaoh can use Reactive Strike when a creature within its reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. It can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and it disrupts actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

items.name: Восстановление
items.description: When a mummy pharaoh is destroyed, necromantic energies rebuild its body in its tomb over [[/br 1d10 #Days to Rejuvenate]]{1d10 days}. If the body is destroyed during that time, the process starts anew. A reforming mummy pharaoh is destroyed permanently if their tomb is consecrated.

items.name: Sacred Wrappings
items.description:
When a creature deals physical damage to the pharaoh or triggers one of the pharaoh's weaknesses, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Regardless of the results of the save, the creature is then immune to that mummy's sacred wrappings for 24 hours.

items.name: Господство над нежитью
items.description:
100 feet.

Commanded or allied undead in the aura that have a lower level than the mummy pharaoh gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, AC, saves, and skill checks.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4M2K16mH4gndHAKa]

items.name: Гнев песчаной бури
items.description:
The mummy pharaoh exhales a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of superheated sand that deals @Damage[5d6[fire],5d6[slashing]]{5d6 fire and 5d6 slashing damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

The mummy pharaoh can't use Sandstorm Wrath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge use Sandstorm Wrath]]{1d4 rounds}.

items.name: Veil of Sand
items.description:
Sand whirls around the mummy pharaoh in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] until the beginning of their next turn. Creatures inside the sand are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W] to those outside it and any living creature ending its turn within the sand takes @Damage[4d6[slashing]]{4d6 рубящего урона} damage with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|basic:true] save

Veil of Sand ends if the mummy takes damage from their water weakness.

Naiad.name: Naiad
Naiad.description:
Naiads protect streams, ponds, springs, and other natural bodies of fresh water. While most naiads lead solitary lives close to their chosen home, sometimes they congregate in coven-like groups where river tributaries meet, performing great magic and blessing the waters of the land. Because naiads' bonds to their bodies of water permit more flexibility, they are the nymphs most likely to interact with humanoids—and even visit their settlements on occasion. Unlike other nymphs, naiads occasionally become adventurers, especially when dark forces seek to despoil nature or otherwise threaten the land, joining forces with others to prevent the corruption of the natural world.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

items.name: Эмпатия животных(*)
items.description: Наяда может задавать вопросы, получать ответы и использовать навык Дипломатии с животными.

items.name: Water Dependent
items.description: A naiad is bonded to a spring, pond, or similar-sized water feature. If she is more than 300 feet away from it for 24 hours or more, she gains the weak adjustments until she returns. She can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond herself to a new body of water.

items.name: Water Healing
items.description: For every 10 minutes a naiad spends soaking in her bonded body of water, she regains @Damage[7[healing]]{7 Hit Points}.

Naiad Queen.name: Naiad Queen
Naiad Queen.description:
Naiad queens rule over pristine wildernesses centered around untouched lakes, massive rivers, or other collective bodies of fresh water. Bards' songs and artists' paintings of these powerful nymphs tend to depict naiad queens in their slightly more humanoid forms, which they don when they make the rare journey into civilized lands to garner allies, gather news, or gauge threats.

Most naiad queens treat those who respect their domains with kindness, but they're fierce—and quick to eliminate foes. Their blinding beauty and breadth of offensive spells make naiad queens fierce opponents if forced into a fight.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

Nymph Queens

Nymph queens are powerful nymphs who rule over entire regions of untouched wilderness, not just single trees or ponds. Every variety of nymph can have a queen. Naiad queens are among the most prominent, and more often interact with nearby mortals. Thus, some scholars refer to naiad queens as simply "nymphs."

items.name: Эмпатия животных(*)
items.description: Наяда может задавать вопросы, получать ответы и использовать навык Дипломатии с животными.

items.name: Tied to the Land
items.description:
The queen is tied to a body of water or area with a great deal of water features.

A nymph queen is intrinsically tied to a specific region. As long as the queen is healthy, the environment is exceptionally resilient, allowing the nymph queen to automatically attempt to counteract any spell that would harm the environment (such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7yWXx3qC4eFNHhxD] ritual), using her spell DC with a counteract rank equal to the highest-rank druid spell she can cast.

When the nymph queen becomes physically or psychologically unhealthy, however, her warded region eventually becomes twisted or unhealthy as well. In that case, restoring the nymph queen swiftly heals the entire region.

items.name: Nymph's Beauty
items.description:
30 feet.

A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and becomes stunned 1 each time it starts its turn within the aura for the next 24 hours, even if it can't see the naiad queen.

Creatures that start their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:23] save or suffer an effect described in the nymph queen's entry.

items.name: Изменение формы
items.description:
Nymph queens can transform between their original form, which looks much like a typical nymph of their kind, and any Small or Medium humanoid form, typically choosing a more humanoid-looking version of their natural form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

items.name: Focus Beauty
items.description:
If a target already affected by nymph's beauty fails its save, the image of the queen sears into the creature's mind, effectively blinding the creature until its vision is restored with sound body or a similar effect.

The naiad queen can Dismiss the effect.

The nymph queen focuses her beauty upon a target, who must attempt a save against her nymph's beauty aura (@Check[type:will|dc:23] save). If the creature fails and was already affected by the aura, it takes a greater effect described in the nymph queen's entry.

A nymph queen can Focus Beauty on a given creature only once per turn.

items.name: Inspiration
items.description:
The nymph queen inspires a single intelligent creature by giving that creature a token of her favor, typically a lock of her hair, though it can be some other significant object as well. As long as the creature carries her token and remains in good standing with her, the creature gains a +1 status bonus to all Crafting checks, Performance checks, and Will saves.

If the nymph grants her token to a bard, and she's the bard's muse, the queen chooses one additional benefit granted by her token: a +1 status bonus to all Lore checks, a +2 status bonus to Performance checks when determining the effects of compositions, a +4 status bonus to untrained skill checks, or a +2 status bonus to Will saves against fey.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.iSyyR4QVOaY6mxtg]

items.name: Water Healing
items.description: For every 10 minutes a naiad spends soaking in any body of water in her domain, she regains @Damage[30[healing]]{30 Hit Points}.

Nessari.name: Nessari
Nessari.description:
When an army of devils invades to bathe a region in bloodshed and hellfire, it is likely that one of the nessaris masterminded the incursion. Cunning, powerful, and ruthless, nessaris often serve the archdevils directly. They rule infernal duchies, subjugate mortal worlds, and usurp infernal rivals using unparalleled despotism and calculated ferocity. To realize their tyrannical machinations, nessaris claim mortal souls that they corrupt into ort servants, which can then be shaped and transformed through infernal manipulation into the terrifying devils that form Hell's formidable legions. They often select the most wicked and vicious orts for their armies, drawing upon these lesser devils' depravity during powerful magical ceremonies to create hideous and terrifying abominations that can cow and eviscerate the nessari's enemies.

Each nessari is crafted deep within the nightmarish bowels of Nessus, the ninth layer of Hell, to serve the whims of archdevils and infernal dukes. Those nessaris that don't leave Nessus to command infernal legions in the upper layers of Hell often form the courts of Hell's elite, gathering cronies and sects that shape Hell's political landscape through subterfuge and manipulation. But many nessaris see themselves as living embodiments of hellfire, the all-encompassing wrath of Hell, and thus prefer to dwell in realms consumed by fire. In Avernus, Dis, Malebolge, Nessus, and Phlegethon, nessaris build vast citadels of brimstone wreathed in flame to lord over.

Rather than being above the constant power struggles of the diabolic ranks, nessaris are in the thick of it. Even apocalyptic schemes to conquer or despoil mortal worlds usually begin from a desire to claw a single rank up the immortal hierarchy of Hell. For this reason, the best, yet also most dangerous, ally against a nessari is the nessari next to them.

Nessaris tower over other devils, standing at least 16 feet tall, weighing over 1,000 pounds, and brandishing wingspans in excess of 20 feet.

Infernal Dukes

Elite members of Hell's political infrastructure and leadership hierarchy, the dukes of Hell are chosen from among the most tyrannical, oppressive, and conniving devils. While not all infernal dukes are nessaris, a nessari's natural disposition toward conquest and oppression often makes them an ideal candidate for this position. To create an infernal duke, adjust the nessari to be between 21st and 25th level. Because of their physical prowess, manipulative nature, and powerful spellcasting abilities, infernal dukes make excellent villains for long-running campaigns.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks.

Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly orts perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as infantry and contract devils, while the greatest nessaris command entire infernal armies.

Asmodeus stands at the apex of the structure he created, but the layers below him are marked by a constant jockeying for position. Most diabolic plans ultimately serve to improve the schemer's place in the hierarchy.
Nessari.allSaves: бонус состояния +1 ко всем спасброскам от магии

items.name: Бонус состояния +1 ко всем спасброскам от магии
Аура командира
items.description:
100 футов.

Командуемые или союзные нечестивые существа в этой ауре, которые ниже уровнем чем нессари, получают бонус обстоятельства +1 к броскам атак, броскам урона, КБ, спасброскам и проверкам навыков.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.5NSWRxAsJuvwyl0E]

items.name: Устрашающее присутствие
items.description:
20 футов. @Check[type:will|dc:42]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

items.name: Реагирующий удар (особый)
items.description:
В дополнение к обычному триггеру, нессари может применять "Реагирующий удар", когда существо в пределах досягаемости использует действие концентрации. Дьявол может прервать спровоцировавшее действия концентрации, и прерывает действия при любом попадании, а не только при критическом.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

items.name: Сжимать
items.description:
@Damage[(2d10+17)[bludgeoning]]{2d10+17 дробящего урона}, простой спасбросок @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43|basic:true]{Стойкости}

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

items.name: Быстрое пикирование
items.description: Нессари @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Летит} и совершает "Удар" крылом в любой момент этого перемещения.

items.name: Мастерское ускоренное колдовство
items.description:
Частота: Раз в раунд

Эффект: Если следующее действие нессари — творить врожденное заклинание 8-го ранга или ниже, снизьте количество действий для его сотворения на 1 (до минимум 1 действия).

items.name: Яд нессари
items.description:
Спасбросок: @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43]

Макс.продолжительность: 10 раундов

Стадия 1: @Damage[6d6[poison]]{6d6 урона ядом} и @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Истощен 1} (1 раунд)

Стадия 2: @Damage[7d6[poison]]{7d6 урона ядом} и @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Истощен 2} (1 раунд)

Стадия 3: @Damage[8d6[poison]]{8d6 урона ядом} и @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Истощен 3} (1 раунд)

items.name: Формирование дьяволов
items.description:
Нессари превращает большое количество ортов в 600 футовой эманации в более могущественных дьяволов, для пополнения легионов Ада. У нессари должно быть в наличии количество ортов, указанное в таблице дальше.

Уровень дьявола Количество орт
4 или меньше 4
5–6 8
7–8 16
9–10 32
11-12 64
13–14 128
15–16 256
17–18 512
19–20 1.024

Нессари может формировать 100 ортов в день, до максимума 1.100 ортов за 11 дней. Созданные таким образом дьяволы находятся в подчинении у этого нессари и выполняют его приказы, за исключением созданных нессари или других дьяволов аналогичной силы, которые всегда независимы. В результате чего, лишь немногие нессари предпочитают создавать равных себе. В конце активности "Формирование дьяволов" нессари совершает невероятно трудную проверку Религии по уровню желаемого дьявола, со следующими результатами.

Критический успех: Вместо 1 дьявола, нессари формирует из массы ортов 2 дьяволов.

Успех: Нессари формирует дьявола желаемого вида и уровня.

Провал: Из ортов формируется дьявол на 2 уровня ниже желаемого.

Критический провал: Нессари не удается сформировать дьяволов и это вызывает гнев архидьявола из-за растраты ресурсов.

items.name: Межпланарный телепорт (только на себя и всадника)
Дым
items.description:
15 feet.

The nightmare continually exhales black smoke. Creatures within the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W] to those outside it, and creatures outside the aura are concealed to creatures within it. Nightmares and their riders can see through this smoke.

A creature that begins its turn in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23|traits:inhaled,poison] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. It's then temporarily immune to being sickened by the smoke for 1 minute. This is an inhaled poison, and the nightmare and its rider are immune to it.

items.name: Огненный галоп
items.description: Кошмар @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Перемещается} или @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Летит} вплоть до утроенной Скорости. Его копыта вспыхивают сильным пламенем, нанося @Damage[3d6[fire]]{3d6 урона огнем} с простым спасброском @Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true]{Рефлекса} один раз каждому существу, рядом с которым во время галопа передвигается кошмар (кроме всадника кошмара). Существо может быть подвержено "Огненному галопу" одни раз за его использование.

Nilith.name: Нилит(*)
Nilith.description:
Гладкие, темные нилиты похожи на безволосых, истощенных древесных ленивцев. Эти существа очень опасны и страшны: у них красные светящиеся глаза, коварные когти и пасть, полная иглоподобных зубов. Нилиты питаются эмоциями, страхами и плотью живых, и, согласно народным преданиям, тем, кому снятся кошмары об этих существах, суждено однажды быть съеденными ими. Нилиты получают огромное удовольствие от мучений разумных существ, часто концентрируя свое хищничество на благочестивых и праведных людях, из которых они вытягивают их самые глубинные страхи и худшие мысли и упиваются последующим ужасом своих жертв. Чаще всего эти отвратительные манипуляторы хотят довести своих жертв до безумия и даже до самоубийства. Большинству нилитов не хватает терпения тратить много времени на то, чтобы окончательно вымотать человека, и когда нилит устает от своей текущей игры и ему надоедают конкретные мысли и страхи, он убивает жертву, а затем питается ее плотью и переходит к следующей жертве.

На самом деле нилиты — это продолжения гораздо более смертоносных существ, обитающих в далеком измерении за пределами сновидений. В некотором смысле нилиты — не более чем удаленные машины для кормления неизвестных инопланетных сущностей, с которыми они связаны. Ученые и путешественники по измерениям пытались раскрыть точные механизмы этой таинственной связи, но им так и не удалось докопаться до истины. Многие, кто исследует природу связи нилитов, доводят себя до безумия, так и не сумев приблизиться к ней. Странная связь с потусторонними существами может объяснить долголетие этих существ: считается, что нилиты могут жить тысячи лет.

К счастью для других, нилиты — одинокие существа, ненавидящие компанию себе подобных, скорее всего потому, что эти предвестники кошмаров не желают вкушать ужасы, которые они приносят другим.

items.name: Сокрушение разума
items.description:
Требования: У нилита @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Схвачено} существо

Эффект: Нилит проникает в разум захваченного существа и навязывает ему разрозненные образы его самых сильных страхов и кошмаров. Схваченное существо получает @Damage[6d6[mental]]{6d6 ментального урона} с простым спасброском @Check[type:will|dc:31|basic:true]{Воли}. В случае критического провала, цель также подвержена заклинанию @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD], и должна сделать второй спасбросок воли от этого эффекта.

Norn.name: Norn
Norn.description:
Ancient beyond imagining, norns are powerful fey women who hold in their hands the physical manifestation of fate and destiny in the form of golden thread. They watch over all life, intervening with reluctance when called upon—or with a vengeance when the strands of fate are twisted and abused by lesser beings. They cut imposing figures, standing 14 feet tall and weighing 800 pounds.

Norns' relationship with the Eldest of the First World is complex. Many among norns serve Magdh the Three, the triune Eldest who some norns believe to be the first norn triumvirate bound together into one entity, as Magdh has three bodies: a Maiden, a Mother, and a Matriarch. Magdh claims to be watching the threads of fate for some ominous prophesied cataclysm, and in addition to assisting in her divinations, Magdh expects the norns who serve her to follow her cryptic commands to help nudge the future away from the brink. However, norns are powerful beings in their own right, themselves capable of granting divine power, and many balk at serving the enigmatic demigod. These norns find the other Eldest even more alien and challenging to interact with, for they believe that while the Eldest wield great power, even these powerful beings should not be granted leave to meddle with fate as much as they desire.

While even the weakest of the Eldest could destroy an unaffiliated norn with ease, they tend to obey the proclamations and judgments of norns when they are spoken. These norns, for their part, use their perceived neutrality judiciously. They know better than to issue too many demands to the Eldest, lest the capricious demigods grow frustrated. And so the balance of power remains tenuous between unaffiliated norns and the Eldest, as it has for eons. Norns know that it's merely a matter of time before the Eldest lose their respect for this tradition and start acting entirely as they please, despite norns' best efforts to rein in their most disruptive actions.

Followers of Fate

In the mortal Universe, some mortals worship norns as deities, while others, especially witches and bards, admire them as patrons or muses. Those who uphold norns as deities are known as Followers of Fate. Norns neither discourage this veneration nor go out of their way to support such worship. Clerics who venerate norns might worship a specific norn or norn triumvirate, or all norns as a whole, but they gain the same benefits regardless of their choice. The religious symbol of Followers of Fate is a pair of shears cutting a golden thread, and their areas of concern are destiny, fate, and the aging process.
Norn.senses: волночувствительность (неточное) 60 футов; обнаружение мировоззрения, обнаружение магии
Norn.allSaves: бонус состояния +1 ко всем спасброскам от магии

items.name: Sense Fate
items.description: Норн автоматически выбрасывает 20 когда бросает инициативу.

items.name: Triumvirate
items.description: This functions as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.52CdldlWMiVTZk1F] ability, except only norns can join a triumvirate, and it functions only as long as exactly three norns are part of the triumvirate. A triumvirate grants the following spells: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wLIvH0AT1u7oa64N], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qsNeG9KZpODSACMq], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.AuIiqc7jjiy1GZ75](once per day), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.CeSh8QcVnqP5OlLj], and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HpIJTVqgXorH9X0L].

items.name: Бонус состояния +1 ко всем спасброскам от магии
Fated
items.description: When a creature is subject to a fortune effect from a norn and a misfortune effect from any source other than a norn (or vice versa), the norn's effect automatically counteracts the other effect and then takes place normally, rather than the two effects canceling each other out. If both the fortune and misfortune effect are from a norn, then the two cancel each other out as normal. At the GM's discretion, powerful entities related to fate or luck, like Desna, Magdh, or Pharasma, can't have their effects negated by this ability.

items.name: Sever Fate
items.description:
When a norn deals void damage with a Strike, she regains @Damage[10[healing]]{10 Hit Points}. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:39] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure).

Further void damage dealt by the norn increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save (or by 2 on a critical failure), to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

items.name: Shift Fate
items.description:
Триггер: A creature within 120 feet attempts a saving throw

Эффект: The creature rolls the saving throw twice, and then the norn decides which result applies. If the norn chooses the lower roll, this is a misfortune effect; if she chooses the higher roll, it's a fortune effect; if they're the same, she decides which trait to apply.

items.name: Snip Thread
items.description:
Частота: 3 раза в день

Эффект: The norn produces a golden thread linked to the fate of a creature within 100 feet of her, then snips it short with her shears. The target takes @Damage[100[void]]{100 урона пустотой} damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:42|basic:true] save). If the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points from this damage, the thread is completely severed and the creature dies immediately.

A creature slain by Snip Thread can't be restored to life except by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu] ritual or similarly powerful magic; or by divine intervention. Regardless of the outcome of their saving throw, a creature targeted by Snip Thread then becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours.

The norn can't use Snip Thread again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Snip Thread]]{1d4 rounds}.

Nosoi.name: Nosoi
Nosoi.description:
A nosoi resembles a whippoorwill, sparrow, or other small bird wearing a heavy leather plague doctor's mask. They are the clerks, messengers, and scribes of the Boneyard, witnessing judgments, directing souls, and generally performing the administrative grunt work that keeps the Boneyard functioning. Most nosois are particularly chatty and eager to discuss how important they consider their individual assignments to be.

Psychopomps are guardians and shepherds of the dead in the Boneyard, the vast plane of graves where mortal souls are judged and sent on to their eternal rewards or damnations. Psychopomps ensure that the dead come to terms with their transition from mortality and are properly sorted into the appropriate afterlife. They also protect souls from being preyed upon by supernatural predators. Nearly all psychopomps wear masks, especially when they're likely to be interacting with mortals, although the types of masks they wear are as varied as the psychopomps themselves. The courts of the Boneyard preside in Requian, a somber yet melodic language spoken slowly with various tonal shifts.

Many psychopomps are intimately involved with the Boneyard's massive bureaucracy. Few pursue mercy, justice, or personal gain; their duties to Pharasma and her Boneyard are supreme. Nevertheless, individual psychopomps interpret their duties in different ways, which might put them in conflict with mortals or even with each other.

items.name: Изменение формы
items.description:
The nosoi takes the appearance of a raven or songbird. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage modifiers with its Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

items.name: Haunting Melody
items.description:
The nosoi croons an entrancing song. Each living or undead creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save. The effect lasts until the end of the nosoi's next turn, but the nosoi can Sustain it. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours. Despite being a mental effect, this ability affects mindless undead.

Psychopomps are immune to this ability.

Провал: The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg] with the nosoi.

Критический провал: The creature is fascinated with the nosoi and must spend each of its actions on its turn to move closer to the nosoi as expediently as possible while avoiding obvious dangers. If a fascinated creature is adjacent to the nosoi, it stays still and doesn't act. If the creature is attacked, the fascination ends.

items.name: Касание пастыря
items.description: A nosoi's Strikes have the benefit of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R] property rune and deal an additional @Damage[1d6[void]]{1d6 урона пустотой} damage to living creatures or @Damage[1d6[vitality]]{1d6 урона жизненностью} damage to undead.

Noxious Needler.name: Noxious Needler
Noxious Needler.description:
This construct is a walking alchemical nightmare capable of inflicting all manner of painful wounds. The noxious needlers' ability to follow orders is granted by the otherwise mindless humanoid brain that floats in their dome-like heads, allowing them to serve as laborers and guards for their creators.

In exceptionally rare cases, the brain used in their creation might retain fragments of memories or even an actual intellect, resulting in a noxious needler with a personality and agenda of its own. Unwilling creations often hunt down their creators, venting their rage on similar targets if revenge is impossible. Others blankly replicate the experiments from their last memory

items.name: Алхимические камеры
items.description:
A noxious needler's body contains six alchemical chambers filled with different substances. When a noxious needler's ability calls upon a randomly determined alchemical effect, roll 1d6 and consult the following (if you roll the result of a chamber that was shattered, there is no alchemical effect):

[[/br 1d6#Алхимические камеры]]{1d6} Алхимический эффект
1

Урон кислотой
2 Урон холодом
3 Урон электричеством
4 Урон огнем
5 Урон ядом
6 Тошнота: спасбросок @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Алхимическая тошнота|traits:disease], иначе @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Тошнота 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Тошнота 2} при критическом провале).

items.name: Алхимический разрыв
items.description:
When a noxious needler takes physical damage from a critical hit or is affected by a shatter spell, one glass chamber within its body shatters, spewing alchemical liquid in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5]. Roll on the alchemical chambers list to determine which one shatters—on a roll of 1–5, creatures in the area take 10d6 damage of the appropriate type (DC 28 basic Reflex). On a roll of 6, creatures must instead save against the sickness effect.

[[/br 1d6#Алхимический разрыв]]{1d6} Алхимический эффект
1

@Damage[10d6[acid]]{10d6 урона кислотой}, @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:acid]
2 @Damage[10d6[cold]]{10d6 урона холодом}, @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:cold]
3 @Damage[10d6[electricity]]{10d6 урона электричеством}, @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:electricity]
4 @Damage[10d6[fire]]{10d6 урона огнем}, @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:fire]
5 @Damage[10d6[poison]]{10d6 урона ядом}, @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:poison]
6 Тошнота: спасбросок @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Алхимическая тошнота|traits:disease], иначе @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Тошнота 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Тошнота 2} при критическом провале)

items.name: Алхимическая инъекция
items.description:
When a noxious needler hits a creature with a syringe Strike, roll 1d6 on the alchemical chambers list to determine the additional effect of the attack. The syringe deals an additional 2d6 damage of the appropriate type (or exposes the target to the sickness effect, as appropriate).

[[/br 1d6#Алхимическая инъекция]]{1d6} Алхимический эффект
1

@Damage[2d6[acid]]{2d6 урона кислотой}
2 @Damage[2d6[cold]]{2d6 урона холодом}
3 @Damage[2d6[electricity]]{2d6 урона электричеством}
4 @Damage[2d6[fire]]{2d6 урона огнем}
5 @Damage[2d6[poison]]{2d6 урона ядом}
6 Тошнота: спасбросок @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Алхимическая тошнота|traits:disease], иначе @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Тошнота 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Тошнота 2} при критическом провале).

items.name: Создание бомбы
items.description:
The needler fills an empty vial from one of its alchemical chambers to create a bomb and then makes a bomb Strike. Roll 1d6 on the table below. On a roll of 1–5, the bomb deals 3d10 damage and 3 splash damage, matching the damage type of the chamber; you can instead choose to create an alchemical bomb of 11th level or lower that deals the same damage type, such as an acid flask on a roll of 1. On a roll of 6, it creates a sickness bomb, which exposes the target and all creatures in the splash radius to the sickness effect; creatures hit by only the splash receive a +2 circumstance bonus to their Fortitude saves.

[[/br 1d6 #Generate Bomb]] Alchemical Effect
1

Acid Damage: @Damage[3d10[acid],(3[splash])[acid]]{3d10 урона кислотой, и ) урона кислотой} damage
2 Cold Damage: @Damage[3d10[cold],(3[splash])[cold]]{3d10 урона холодом, и ) урона холодом} damage
3 Electricity Damage: @Damage[3d10[electricity],(3[splash])[electricity]]{3d10 урона электричеством, и ) урона электричеством} damage
4 Fire Damage: @Damage[3d10[fire],(3[splash])[fire]]{3d10 урона огнем, и ) урона огнем} damage
5 Poison Damage: @Damage[3d10[poison],(3[splash])[poison]]{3d10 урона ядом, и ) урона ядом} damage
6 Sickness: @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Alchemical Sickness|traits:disease] save or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure)

Nuckelavee.name: Nuckelavee
Nuckelavee.description:
When pollution despoils a natural waterway, it draws the dreaded nuckelavee to it from the First World. This spirit of wrath is a grisly sight to behold: a horselike monstrosity with the gnarled upper body of a humanoid growing directly from its back. Further enhancing its awfulness, not a patch of skin exists on the misshapen hybrid form, as though it survived its own flaying.

When a nuckelavee rides forth from its domain, it wreaks a trail of destruction across the land surrounding its path. Nuckelavees are considered among the cruelest and most monstrous fey, seen by some as just desserts visited upon those who would befoul the waters of their homes. A nuckelavee, however, doesn't discriminate between those who pollute and those who merely have the misfortune to be in the wrong place at the wrong time.

Despite their vile reputation among humanoids, nuckelavees are generally respectful of their fey counterparts. Once pollution has been cleansed and water fey like naiads return to a body of water, nuckelavees will peacefully withdraw.

items.name: Устрашающее присутствие
items.description:
30 футов. @Check[type:will|dc:25]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

items.name: Уязвимость к чистоте
items.description:
Unpolluted fresh water burns a nuckelavee like acid, dealing @Damage[1d6[acid]]{1d6 урона кислотой} damage to it and causing it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

A nuckelavee can't heal from damage when it's in an area that isn't polluted (subject to GM discretion).

items.name: Blight Breath
items.description:
The nuckelavee breathes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of foulness, dealing @Damage[8d6[void]]{8d6 урона пустотой} damage to living creatures in the area with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|basic:true] save. A creature that fails also takes @Damage[2d6[bleed]]{2d6 урона кровотечением} damage.

The nuckelavee can't use Blight Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Blight Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

items.name: Mortasheen
items.description:
The target can't recover from the fatigued condition caused by mortasheen until the disease is cured. Mortasheen gains the virulent trait against animals and plants

Спасбросок: @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28]

Стадия 1: Переносчик не имеет эффектов заболевания (1 день)

Стадия 2: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Истощен 1} и @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Утомление} (1 день)

Стадия 3: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Истощен 2} и @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Утомление} (1 день)

Стадия 4: смерть

items.name: Растоптать
items.description:
Средний или менее, копыто, простой спасбросок @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true]{Рефлекса}

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

Ofalth.name: Офалт
Ofalth.description:
Fully grown ofalths capture victims and slowly eat them alive.

Found in castle dung heaps, city dumps, and sewers, ofalths are living amalgamations of wet detritus, sewage, and rubbish. They carry a disease called wretched weeps that causes the victim's blood to seep from its pores.

items.name: Мусорная куча
items.description:
Когда ему не угрожает опасность, офалт может потратить 1 минуту на то, чтобы взгромоздиться 10-футовой кучей, похожей на кучу мусора. До тех пор пока он не совершит дейтствие, онПри этом он получает бонус обстоятельства +2 к КБ.

Существо, попадающее в область мусорной кучи или взаимодействующее с ней, должно совершить спасбросок против вони.

items.name: Копошение в нечистотах
items.description: Офалт получает @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Быстрое исцеление 2}, находясь в местах с высокой концентрацией мусора или экскрементов, например в мусорных кучах или канализации.

items.name: Вонь
items.description:
30 футов, @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Stench]

items.name: Отходный плач
items.description:
Спасбросок: @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

Стадия 1: Переносчик не имеет эффектов заболевания (1 день)

Стадия 2: @Damage[2d4[bleed]]{2d4 урона кровотечением} каждый час и @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Ослаблен 1} (1 день)

Стадия 3: @Damage[2d6[bleed]]{2d6 урона кровотечением} каждый час и @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Ослаблен 2} (1 день)

Ogre Boss.name: Огр-босс
Ogre Boss.description:
In ogre society, might makes more than right—it makes the rules. The strongest or most violent ogre in a family (in most cases, this is the same ogre) is invariably that family's boss. Quick to hook fallen foes on their weapons, even other ogres fear the repercussions of displeasing an ogre boss. When an ogre boss barks out commands, the other members of the family move quickly to obey.

For many societies, ogres embody brutish, amoral violence and greedy cruelty. Standing 10 feet tall and densely muscled, ogres are usually as strong as they are vicious. The worst ogres are sadists, enjoying remorseless murder, torture, and violence in all of its forms. Although they prefer to vent their violent urges on other humanoids—the smaller the better—ogre captivity can end in a horrifying fate for anyone unlucky enough to fall within their meaty grasp: becoming dinner. But for all their creativity in inflicting pain, ogres often forget that their playthings lack their own robust fortitude and high pain tolerance, and many of their captives die sooner than the ogres might prefer. Meanwhile, those who manage to survive captivity in an ogre's larder often emerge with lasting mental scars. A captive able to keep their wits about them, however, can sometimes trick the brutes by promising treasure, more plentiful food sources, or other crude amusements, taking advantage of an ogre's often-limited intellect to engineer opportunities to escape or gain revenge.

Ogres are social creatures only in the most debased sense. They gather together in groups called families, though members are not always related by blood. The most powerful ogre in any family is the "boss"—usually the family's patriarch or matriarch—whom the other ogres in the family learn to quickly obey or risk being brutalized by the boss's loyal kin. Ogres lair in caves, crumbling ruins, or dilapidated shacks close enough to humanoid settlements or animal trails to make raiding easy. Their lairs are filthy and frequently contain all-too-recognizable evidence of their depravity, along with assorted treasures stolen from past captives.

items.name: Рявкающий приказ
items.description: Огр-босс отдает команду, чтобы поторопить своих товарищей. Каждый союзный огр, который слышит и понимает эту команду, становится @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Ускорен} до конца своего следующего хода, но может использовать это дополнительное действие, только на @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Шаг} или @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Перемещение}.

items.name: Размашистый крюк
items.description:
Триггер: Огр-босс успешно @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Опрокидывает} существо огрским крюком

Эффект: Огр-босс наносит "Удар" крюком огра по опрокинутому им существу.

Ogre Glutton.name: Огр-обжора
Ogre Glutton.description:
Ogre gluttons take the act of feeding to a horrific extreme, capable of extending their already cavernous mouths wide enough to gulp down a halfling. Stories of ogre gluttons being tricked into eating razor-edged shields or barrels filled with poisoned meat are common, but such tales are of little consolation to those who have been gobbled whole by these ravenous giants. In addition to their sadistic table manners, ogre gluttons have a disturbing knack for coming up with violent "games" that are little more than drawn-out torments, yet those who somehow manage to beat a glutton at the rules of their own game can often enrage the ogre enough that the resulting tantrum provides an opportunity for the captives to escape.

For many societies, ogres embody brutish, amoral violence and greedy cruelty. Standing 10 feet tall and densely muscled, ogres are usually as strong as they are vicious. The worst ogres are sadists, enjoying remorseless murder, torture, and violence in all of its forms. Although they prefer to vent their violent urges on other humanoids—the smaller the better—ogre captivity can end in a horrifying fate for anyone unlucky enough to fall within their meaty grasp: becoming dinner. But for all their creativity in inflicting pain, ogres often forget that their playthings lack their own robust fortitude and high pain tolerance, and many of their captives die sooner than the ogres might prefer. Meanwhile, those who manage to survive captivity in an ogre's larder often emerge with lasting mental scars. A captive able to keep their wits about them, however, can sometimes trick the brutes by promising treasure, more plentiful food sources, or other crude amusements, taking advantage of an ogre's often-limited intellect to engineer opportunities to escape or gain revenge.

Ogres are social creatures only in the most debased sense. They gather together in groups called families, though members are not always related by blood. The most powerful ogre in any family is the "boss"—usually the family's patriarch or matriarch—whom the other ogres in the family learn to quickly obey or risk being brutalized by the boss's loyal kin. Ogres lair in caves, crumbling ruins, or dilapidated shacks close enough to humanoid settlements or animal trails to make raiding easy. Their lairs are filthy and frequently contain all-too-recognizable evidence of their depravity, along with assorted treasures stolen from past captives.

items.name: Пир обжоры
items.description: Если огр-обжора наносит урон живому существу своим "Ударом" челюстями, то на 1 минуту получает [[/r 1d4 #Временные ОЗ]]{1d4 ВОЗ}.

items.name: Нападение обжоры
items.description: Огр-обжора @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Перемещается} дважды и совершает "Удар" челюстями. Если он наносит этим "Ударом" урон живому существу, то временные ОЗ, получаемые от "Пира обжоры" увеличиваются до [[/r 2d4#Временные ОЗ]]{2d4}.

items.name: Проглотить целиком
items.description:
Маленький, @Damage[(2d4+4)[bludgeoning]]{2d4+4 дробящего урона}, Разрыв 14

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

Ogre Warrior.name: Огр-воин
Ogre Warrior.description:
The simplest of ogres are slabs of muscle with hateful eyes, misshapen visages, and malformed bodies. Always eager for mayhem and murder, ogre warriors are quick to turn on their kin when there's a shortage of smaller folk to torment, so those who lead ogres do their best to keep them constantly distracted with new opportunities for raids and ruin.

For many societies, ogres embody brutish, amoral violence and greedy cruelty. Standing 10 feet tall and densely muscled, ogres are usually as strong as they are vicious. The worst ogres are sadists, enjoying remorseless murder, torture, and violence in all of its forms. Although they prefer to vent their violent urges on other humanoids—the smaller the better—ogre captivity can end in a horrifying fate for anyone unlucky enough to fall within their meaty grasp: becoming dinner. But for all their creativity in inflicting pain, ogres often forget that their playthings lack their own robust fortitude and high pain tolerance, and many of their captives die sooner than the ogres might prefer. Meanwhile, those who manage to survive captivity in an ogre's larder often emerge with lasting mental scars. A captive able to keep their wits about them, however, can sometimes trick the brutes by promising treasure, more plentiful food sources, or other crude amusements, taking advantage of an ogre's often-limited intellect to engineer opportunities to escape or gain revenge.

Ogres are social creatures only in the most debased sense. They gather together in groups called families, though members are not always related by blood. The most powerful ogre in any family is the "boss"—usually the family's patriarch or matriarch—whom the other ogres in the family learn to quickly obey or risk being brutalized by the boss's loyal kin. Ogres lair in caves, crumbling ruins, or dilapidated shacks close enough to humanoid settlements or animal trails to make raiding easy. Their lairs are filthy and frequently contain all-too-recognizable evidence of their depravity, along with assorted treasures stolen from past captives.

Omen Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Дракон знамений (взрослый, заклинатель)(*)
Omen Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).description:
Fate is a fickle matter on Golarion. Even with prophecy broken on the world, there are ways to look to the immediate future or acquire a vague sense of long-term events. Omen dragons are bound to see the future—nebulous though it might be—at all times. Visions of the future hound them like a quiet song that never stops playing in their minds. While an omen dragon can focus on or ignore the music of fate at any time, the song plays all the same. At a glance, omen dragons resemble other occult dragons in appearance, save for the mirror-like interior membrane of their wings. An omen dragon's wings offer glimpses into the future. These glimpses are cloudy and vague, but generally correct, if only technically. Omen dragons have a natural compulsion to share the futures they see. These dragons have no compunctions about what the visions show and share their knowledge equally with innocent villagers as they do with wicked tyrants.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Omen Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: бонус состояния +2 ко всем спасброскам от оккультных

items.name: Бонус состояния +2 ко всем спасброскам от оккультных
Бросить вызов судьбе
items.description:
Триггер: Дракон является целью атаки

Эффект: Эта судьба не предначертана. Атакующий бросает спровоцировавшую атаку дважды и использует худший результат.

items.name: Не привязанный к судьбе
items.description: Дракон может отменить любые эффекты удачи или неудачи, которые бы на него подействовали; на других существ эти эффекты действуют как обычно.

items.name: Дыхание судьбы
items.description:
Дракон дышит полупрозрачным туманом потенциальных возможностей в @Template[type:cone|distance:30]{30-футовом конусе}, который переполняет существ видениями возможного будущего и наносит @Damage[10d6[mental]]{10d6 ментального урона} (простой спасбросок @Check[type:will|dc:30|basic:true]{Воли}). В случае провала существа @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Замедлено 1} на 1 раунд (или @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Замедлено 2} при критическом провале), так как борется с видениями.

Он не может снова использовать "Дыхание судьбы" [[/br 1d4 #Перезарядка дыхания судьбы]]{1d4 раунда}.

items.name: Пророческие крылья
items.description:
Дракон или любой союзник может заглянуть в будущее через крылья дракона, что требует 10 минут концентрации. Это заклинание @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Предзнаменование} 6-го ранга, за исключением того, что крылья могут предсказывать результаты на срок до 1 месяца вперед, и дракон всегда произносит несколько загадочных слов, связанных с результатом предсказания.

Дракон может использовать свои крылья таким образом только один раз в день, а данное существо может искать свое будущее в крыльях только один раз в неделю.

items.name: Прогулка по временным линиям
items.description:
Частота: Раз в час

Эффект: Дракон разделяет себя на две версии с разными судьбами. Каждая копия @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Перемещается} или @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Летит} из текущего пространства дракона, затем совершает одно действие. Если оба действия являются атаками, они используют один и тот же штраф множественной атаки и считаются одной атакой для штрафа множественной атаки дракона.

После обоих действий дракон выбирает одно из двух пространств в качестве своего настоящего местоположения, а его вторая версия исчезает.

items.name: Драконий импульс

items.description: Дракон может отменить любые эффекты удачи или неудачи, которые бы на него подействовали; на других существ эти эффекты действуют как обычно.

items.name: Дыхание судьбы
items.description:
Дракон дышит полупрозрачным туманом потенциальных возможностей в @Template[type:cone|distance:40]{40-футовом конусе}, который переполняет существ видениями возможного будущего и наносит @Damage[15d6[mental]]{15d6 ментального урона} (простой спасбросок @Check[type:will|dc:39|basic:true]{Воли}). В случае провала существа @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Замедлено 1} на 1 раунд (или @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Замедлено 2} при критическом провале), так как борется с видениями.

Он не может снова использовать "Дыхание судьбы" [[/br 1d4 #Перезарядка дыхания судьбы]]{1d4 раунда}.

items.name: Драконье неистовство
items.description: Дракон в любом порядке наносит 2 "Удара" когтями и 1 "Удар" крылом.

items.name: Драконий импульс
items.description: Когда дракон совершает критическое попадание "Ударом", он перезаряжает свое "Дыхание судьбы".

items.name: Неотвратимая судьба
items.description: Атаки дракона приближают противников к их конечной судьбе. Когда дракон наносит критически попадает "Ударом" или существо критически проваливает спасбросок от "Дыхания судьбы" дракона, оно становится @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Обречено 1}, или увеличивает значение обреченности на 1, если оно уже было обречено.

items.name: Пророческие крылья
items.description:
Дракон или любой союзник может заглянуть в будущее через крылья дракона, что требует 10 минут концентрации. Это заклинание @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Предзнаменование} 8-го ранга, за исключением того, что крылья могут предсказывать результаты на срок до 1 года вперед, и дракон всегда произносит несколько загадочных слов, связанных с результатом предсказания.

Дракон может использовать свои крылья таким образом только один раз в день, а данное существо может искать свое будущее в крыльях только один раз в неделю.

items.name: Прогулка по временным линиям
items.description:
Частота: Раз в час

Эффект: Дракон разделяет себя на две версии с разными судьбами. Каждая копия @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Перемещается} или @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Летит} из текущего пространства дракона, затем совершает одно действие. Если оба действия являются атаками, они используют один и тот же штраф множественной атаки и считаются одной атакой для штрафа множественной атаки дракона.

После обоих действий дракон выбирает одно из двух пространств в качестве своего настоящего местоположения, а его вторая версия исчезает.

Omen Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Дракон знамений (молодой, заклинатель)(*)
Omen Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).description:
Fate is a fickle matter on Golarion. Even with prophecy broken on the world, there are ways to look to the immediate future or acquire a vague sense of long-term events. Omen dragons are bound to see the future—nebulous though it might be—at all times. Visions of the future hound them like a quiet song that never stops playing in their minds. While an omen dragon can focus on or ignore the music of fate at any time, the song plays all the same. At a glance, omen dragons resemble other occult dragons in appearance, save for the mirror-like interior membrane of their wings. An omen dragon's wings offer glimpses into the future. These glimpses are cloudy and vague, but generally correct, if only technically. Omen dragons have a natural compulsion to share the futures they see. These dragons have no compunctions about what the visions show and share their knowledge equally with innocent villagers as they do with wicked tyrants.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Omen Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).allSaves: бонус состояния +2 ко всем спасброскам от оккультных

items.name: Бонус состояния +2 ко всем спасброскам от оккультных
Бросить вызов судьбе
items.description:
Триггер: Дракон является целью атаки

Эффект: Эта судьба не предначертана. Атакующий бросает спровоцировавшую атаку дважды и использует худший результат.

items.name: Не привязанный к судьбе
items.description: Дракон может отменить любые эффекты удачи или неудачи, которые бы на него подействовали; на других существ эти эффекты действуют как обычно.

items.description:

В случае провала существа @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Замедлено 1} на 1 раунд (или @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Замедлено 2} при критическом провале), так как борется с видениями.

Он не может снова использовать "Дыхание судьбы" [[/br 1d4 #Перезарядка дыхания судьбы]]{1d4 раунда}.

Это заклинание @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Предзнаменование} 4-го ранга, за исключением того, что крылья могут предсказывать результаты на срок до 1 дня вперед, и дракон всегда произносит несколько загадочных слов, связанных с результатом предсказания.

Omox.name: Омокс
Omox.description:
Seemingly made from living, animated filth, omoxes have no true anatomy, although they generally spend most of their time in roughly humanoid shapes, resembling some grim caricatures of half-melted humanoids. While scholars once believed these foul demons to be a pure, concentrated form of the corruption that suffuses the Outer Rifts and its inhabitants, in truth these demons arise from the souls of those who routinely befouled and polluted their surroundings in life.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.
Omox.allSaves: бонус состояния +1 ко всем спасброскам от магии

items.name: Уязвимость к чистоплотности
items.description:
Омокс воплощает нечистоты, и ему отвратительно понятие чистоты. Омокс, подвергшийся очищающему его эффекту, например, "Уборке" от @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Qw3fnUlaUbnn7ipC]{Престидижитации}, получает @Damage[2d6[mental]]{2d6 ментального урона}.

Он также получает этот урон каждый раунд, когда первый раз существо, пораженное одной из атак омокса, тратит действия на очищение от грязи.

items.name: Бонус состояния +1 ко всем спасброскам от магии
Поглотить оружие
items.description:
Триггер: Существо попадает по омоксу оружием ближнего боя

Эффект: Омокс пытается @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Разоружить} существо. При критическом успехе, вместо того, чтобы падать на землю, это оружие оказывается в теле омокса. Чтобы вернуть его, сначала надо "Разоружить" от него омокса.

items.name: Жидкий прыжок
items.description:
Требования: Омокс находится в пространстве жидкости

Эффект: Омокс телепортируется из текущего пространства в любое незанятое пространство жидкости в пределах 120 футов.

items.name: Слизевая ловушка
items.description:
A creature hit by an omox's slime ball must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:32] save or take a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute or until it [[/act escape dc=35]]{Escapes (DC 35)}. On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for the same duration.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.XSAmMuMgMvdjdpHc]

items.name: Облепить
items.description:
Требования: У омокса есть @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Схваченное} или @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Сдерживаемое} существо

Эффект: Демон обтекает существо, покрывая его сочащейся кислотной слизью. Существо должно совершить успешный спасбросок @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32]{Стойкости}, иначе станет @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Слепым} и должно задерживать дыхание, иначе начнет @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.G1Rje9eYCFEByzjg#tonutь-i-zadyhatьsya]{задыхаться}. Эти эффекты длятся пока существо схваченно или сдерживаемо омоксом.

Orc Commander.name: Орк командир
Orc Commander.description:
When orcs raid, the strongest is chosen as the leader, backed up by their siblings and other immediate family. If leadership is contested, candidates vie for control with displays of physical prowess or stirring speeches.

Many orcs are forged in the fires of violence and conflict, often from the moment they're born. As they live lives that are frequently cut brutally short, orcs revel in testing their strength against worthy foes, whether by challenging a higher-ranking member of their community for dominance, taming a powerful beast, or slaying a fearsome monster.

Tall and powerful, with long arms and thickly muscled legs, many orcs top 7 feet in height. Their heavy limbs and broad, almost bow-legged stances combine with a tendency to slouch forward to create an almost contradictory set of circumstances where an orc can tower over other humanoids while simultaneously staring them in the eye. These features, alongside a tendency to scar easily, can make them seem quite intimidating.

The half-orc dromaars, most commonly born of unions between orcs and humans, are often tested even more harshly than their full orc kin, but those who endure these tests can rise to positions of authority. "An orc can have what an orc can hold" is a saying that not only applies to an individual's ability to secure their own destiny and position, but is also likely the root of orcs referring to their communities as holds.

items.name: Боевой клич
items.description:
Издавая мощный рев, орк командир дает себе и всем союзным оркам в радиусе @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60-футовой эманации}, бонус состояния +1 к броскам атак и урона, до начала следующего хода командира.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Yqq4AkZ9lrm4CcID]

Orc Scrapper.name: Orc Scrapper
Orc Scrapper.description:
Acting as the most common orc combat unit, orc scrappers are ferocious fighters who rely on unrelenting strength, rather than combat experience, to prove their mettle and attempt to rise in the hold's standing.

Many orcs are forged in the fires of violence and conflict, often from the moment they're born. As they live lives that are frequently cut brutally short, orcs revel in testing their strength against worthy foes, whether by challenging a higher-ranking member of their community for dominance, taming a powerful beast, or slaying a fearsome monster.

Tall and powerful, with long arms and thickly muscled legs, many orcs top 7 feet in height. Their heavy limbs and broad, almost bow-legged stances combine with a tendency to slouch forward to create an almost contradictory set of circumstances where an orc can tower over other humanoids while simultaneously staring them in the eye. These features, alongside a tendency to scar easily, can make them seem quite intimidating.

The half-orc dromaars, most commonly born of unions between orcs and humans, are often tested even more harshly than their full orc kin, but those who endure these tests can rise to positions of authority. "An orc can have what an orc can hold" is a saying that not only applies to an individual's ability to secure their own destiny and position, but is also likely the root of orcs referring to their communities as holds.

items.name: Нагрудник (низкокачественный)
items.description: Несмотря на то, что он называется нагрудником, этот тип доспеха состоит из нескольких частей латного или @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.pRoikbRo5HFW6YUB]{Полулатного доспеха}, которые защищают туловище, грудь, шею, а иногда бедра и ноги.
